Leaf Spot.symptoms: Brown or black circular spots on the leaves, often surrounded by yellow halos. Infected leaves may fall off prematurely.
Leaf Spot.treatment: Remove and destroy affected leaves. Avoid overhead watering. Apply a copper-based fungicide if the problem persists.

Powdery Mildew.symptoms: White or gray powdery patches on the surface of leaves, stems, and buds. Leaves may become distorted or stunted.
Powdery Mildew.treatment: Ensure good air circulation. Apply neem oil, sulfur spray, or potassium bicarbonate to control the spread.

Rust.symptoms: Orange, yellow, or reddish-brown pustules on the underside of leaves. May cause leaf drop and reduced plant vigor.
Rust.treatment: Prune and destroy infected leaves. Use sulfur or copper-based fungicides. Avoid wetting leaves during irrigation.

Blight.symptoms: Sudden browning and wilting of leaves, black lesions on stems, and rapid plant decline.
Blight.treatment: Remove and destroy infected plants. Avoid overhead irrigation. Apply appropriate fungicide and improve soil drainage.

Healthy.symptoms: Leaves appear vibrant, green, and free of any visible spots, discoloration, or deformities.
Healthy.treatment: No treatment required. Continue with proper plant care, regular watering, and periodic monitoring for any changes.
